name: Gary Oldman
description: Renowned British actor known for his versatility and intense performances.

content.title: Biography
content.body: Gary Oldman was born in 1958 in London, England. He trained at the Rose Bruford College of Theatre & Performance and began his acting career on stage before moving into film.

content.title: Career
content.body: Oldman gained prominence with roles in films such as *Sid and Nancy* (1986), *Prick Up Your Ears* (1987), and *Rosencrantz & Guildenstern Are Dead* (1990). He is acclaimed for his performances in movies like *JFK* (1991), *Dracula* (1992), *The Fifth Element* (1997), and *The Dark Knight Trilogy* (2005-2012). His role as Winston Churchill in *Darkest Hour* (2017) earned him an Academy Award for Best Actor.

content.title: Notable Collaborations
content.body: Oldman has frequently collaborated with director Christopher Nolan, working in *The Dark Knight Trilogy*. He has also worked with other renowned directors such as Luc Besson and Francis Ford Coppola.

content.title: Legacy
content.body: Gary Oldman is regarded as one of the greatest actors of his generation, known for his chameleonic ability to transform into his characters. He has been awarded an Academy Award, a Golden Globe, and several BAFTA Awards. His impact is evident in the wide range of genres he has influenced, from drama to science fiction.
